values.description: OpenAL v1.20.0 removed the names ALCdevice\_struct and ALCcontext\_struct \(https://github.com/kcat/openal-soft/commit/399dfca1e3352050a5289be6bcd7b7dce353ccf8\). Use the types ALCdevice and ALCcontext instead.
values.title: Rename OpenAL types to remove _struct

summary.raw: OpenAL v1.20.0 removed the names ALCdevice\_struct and ALCcontext\_struct \(https://github.com/kcat/openal-soft/commit/399dfca1e3352050a5289be6bcd7b7dce353ccf8\). Use the types ALCdevice and ALCcontext instead.

values.description: This pull request is to reduce the inclusion of `Winsock2.h` in many headers and source files. This is motivated by the fact that `Windows.h` or `Winsock2.h` are using large namespaces and very often resulting in name conflicts. My intention is to reduce the chances hitting this problem when consuming `Gazebo` headers with other downstream projects.
values.title: [Windows][Gazebo9] Reduce the WinSock header inclusion

summary.raw: This pull request is to reduce the inclusion of `Winsock2.h` in many headers and source files. This is motivated by the fact that `Windows.h` or `Winsock2.h` are using large namespaces and very often resulting in name conflicts. My intention is to reduce the chances hitting this problem when consuming `Gazebo` headers with other downstream projects.
summary.html: This pull request is to reduce the inclusion of Winsock2.h in many headers and source files. This is motivated by the fact that Windows.h or Winsock2.h are using large namespaces and very often resulting in name conflicts. My intention is to reduce the chances hitting this problem when consuming Gazebo headers with other downstream projects.

values.description:
A race condition can happen on startup on the rendering side when a plugin calls `Model::SetScale`, which leads to incorrect scale of visual being set.

The problem occurs if the model msg with scale information arrives on the rendering side before the initial scene msg is processed. In this case, the visual now incorrectly associates the new scale with the initial visual geometry size instead of updating the geometry to a size based on the new scale. 

The workaround is to send the full model msg from the physics side to the rendering side with visuals data when a scale is set to make sure both scale and geometry data are processed at the same time.

Note that the problem is difficult to reproduce. We ran into the problem when launching a simulation that takes >10 econds to load. The test added does not reproduce the problem but it verifies the contents of the new model msg when `Model::SetScale` is called.
values.title: Workaround for race condition when setting model scale

summary.raw:
A race condition can happen on startup on the rendering side when a plugin calls `Model::SetScale`, which leads to incorrect scale of visual being set.

The problem occurs if the model msg with scale information arrives on the rendering side before the initial scene msg is processed. In this case, the visual now incorrectly associates the new scale with the initial visual geometry size instead of updating the geometry to a size based on the new scale. 

The workaround is to send the full model msg from the physics side to the rendering side with visuals data when a scale is set to make sure both scale and geometry data are processed at the same time.

Note that the problem is difficult to reproduce. We ran into the problem when launching a simulation that takes >10 econds to load. The test added does not reproduce the problem but it verifies the contents of the new model msg when `Model::SetScale` is called.
summary.html:
A race condition can happen on startup on the rendering side when a plugin calls Model::SetScale, which leads to incorrect scale of visual being set.

The problem occurs if the model msg with scale information arrives on the rendering side before the initial scene msg is processed. In this case, the visual now incorrectly associates the new scale with the initial visual geometry size instead of updating the geometry to a size based on the new scale.

The workaround is to send the full model msg from the physics side to the rendering side with visuals data when a scale is set to make sure both scale and geometry data are processed at the same time.

Note that the problem is difficult to reproduce. We ran into the problem when launching a simulation that takes >10 econds to load. The test added does not reproduce the problem but it verifies the contents of the new model msg when Model::SetScale is called.

values.description:
JointController: use ignition::msgs::JointCmd and its new optional fields

The `ignition-msgs3` release changed the protobuf syntax from `proto2` to `proto3`, which caused problems with the `JointCmd` message used by the JointController since `proto3` does not support optional fields for primitive types, and the `JointCmd` and its included `PID` messages both have floating point fields (force, target, gains, etc). A workaround was made in  5ad2a9c of pull request #3139 that causes the JointController to use `gazebo::msgs::JointCmd` instead of `ignition::msgs::JointCmd`, since gazebo_msgs still uses `proto2` syntax.

In ignition-msgs5, new optional fields of the custom message type `Double` were added to the `JointCmd` message ([ign-msgs pr 162](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/162/citadel-deprecate-all-double-fields-in/diff)), so that the `ignition::msgs::JointCmd` can have the same functionality as the `proto2` messages. This pull request switches to use the ignition message and updates to the necessary fields. It currently ignores the deprecated fields. Please advise if we should set both fields and try to read from the deprecated field if the optional field is not set.
values.title: JointController: use ignition::msgs::JointCmd and its new optional fields

summary.raw:
JointController: use ignition::msgs::JointCmd and its new optional fields

The `ignition-msgs3` release changed the protobuf syntax from `proto2` to `proto3`, which caused problems with the `JointCmd` message used by the JointController since `proto3` does not support optional fields for primitive types, and the `JointCmd` and its included `PID` messages both have floating point fields (force, target, gains, etc). A workaround was made in  5ad2a9c of pull request #3139 that causes the JointController to use `gazebo::msgs::JointCmd` instead of `ignition::msgs::JointCmd`, since gazebo_msgs still uses `proto2` syntax.

In ignition-msgs5, new optional fields of the custom message type `Double` were added to the `JointCmd` message ([ign-msgs pr 162](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/162/citadel-deprecate-all-double-fields-in/diff)), so that the `ignition::msgs::JointCmd` can have the same functionality as the `proto2` messages. This pull request switches to use the ignition message and updates to the necessary fields. It currently ignores the deprecated fields. Please advise if we should set both fields and try to read from the deprecated field if the optional field is not set.
summary.html:
JointController: use ignition::msgs::JointCmd and its new optional fields

The ignition-msgs3 release changed the protobuf syntax from proto2 to proto3, which caused problems with the JointCmd message used by the JointController since proto3 does not support optional fields for primitive types, and the JointCmd and its included PID messages both have floating point fields (force, target, gains, etc). A workaround was made in 5ad2a9c of pull request #3139 that causes the JointController to use gazebo::msgs::JointCmd instead of ignition::msgs::JointCmd, since gazebo_msgs still uses proto2 syntax.

In ignition-msgs5, new optional fields of the custom message type Double were added to the JointCmd message (ign-msgs pr 162), so that the ignition::msgs::JointCmd can have the same functionality as the proto2 messages. This pull request switches to use the ignition message and updates to the necessary fields. It currently ignores the deprecated fields. Please advise if we should set both fields and try to read from the deprecated field if the optional field is not set.

values.description:
In pull request #3139, it was not clear to me how to convert the CameraSensor image format to the `ignition::msgs::PixelFormatType` enum, so I commented out that line of code. I've since added `ConvertPixelFormatType` functions to [ign-msgs pr 169](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/169/add-convertpixelformattype-functions-to/diff), targeting a 5.1 release and used it in this branch.

While I was here, I fixed a bug in the image format enum already fixed in ign-common and copied a test for `Image::ConvertPixelFormat` from ign-common.

* PixelFormat: BAYER_RGGR8 -> BAYER_BGGR8 (port fix from ign-common)
* Add test for Image::ConvertPixelFormat
values.title: Require ign-msgs5 5.1 and use ignition::msgs::ConvertPixelFormatType in CameraSensor

summary.raw:
In pull request #3139, it was not clear to me how to convert the CameraSensor image format to the `ignition::msgs::PixelFormatType` enum, so I commented out that line of code. I've since added `ConvertPixelFormatType` functions to [ign-msgs pr 169](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/169/add-convertpixelformattype-functions-to/diff), targeting a 5.1 release and used it in this branch.

While I was here, I fixed a bug in the image format enum already fixed in ign-common and copied a test for `Image::ConvertPixelFormat` from ign-common.

* PixelFormat: BAYER_RGGR8 -> BAYER_BGGR8 (port fix from ign-common)
* Add test for Image::ConvertPixelFormat
summary.html:
In pull request #3139, it was not clear to me how to convert the CameraSensor image format to the ignition::msgs::PixelFormatType enum, so I commented out that line of code. I've since added ConvertPixelFormatType functions to ign-msgs pr 169, targeting a 5.1 release and used it in this branch.

While I was here, I fixed a bug in the image format enum already fixed in ign-common and copied a test for Image::ConvertPixelFormat from ign-common.

  • PixelFormat: BAYER_RGGR8 -> BAYER_BGGR8 (port fix from ign-common)
  • Add test for Image::ConvertPixelFormat

values.description:
As discussed in issue #2681, the homebrew builds are broken since qt 5.14 has been released:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64&build=353)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/353/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/353/

The solution is to `#ifndef Q_MOC_RUN` some more header files to fix compilation of the affected plugins.
* changelog
values.title: Use ifndef Q_MOC_RUN to fix compilation of plugins with tbb and qt 5.14 (issue #2681)

values.description:
The race condition during teardown in #2019 seems related to `gazebo::transport::IOManager`, so I've tried using `std::atomic_int` for its reference count variable instead of a plain `int`. It doesn't solve the problem, but I think it's an improvement. I've also Pimplized the class it in case future changes need to be made.

Replacing `boost::bind` and `boost::thread` is another good step that can be done later, but is an invitation to a rabbit hole that I am avoiding.
values.title: Pimplize IOManager and use atomic_int

summary.raw:
The race condition during teardown in #2019 seems related to `gazebo::transport::IOManager`, so I've tried using `std::atomic_int` for its reference count variable instead of a plain `int`. It doesn't solve the problem, but I think it's an improvement. I've also Pimplized the class it in case future changes need to be made.

Replacing `boost::bind` and `boost::thread` is another good step that can be done later, but is an invitation to a rabbit hole that I am avoiding.
summary.html:
The race condition during teardown in #2019 seems related to gazebo::transport::IOManager, so I've tried using std::atomic_int for its reference count variable instead of a plain int. It doesn't solve the problem, but I think it's an improvement. I've also Pimplized the class it in case future changes need to be made.

Replacing boost::bind and boost::thread is another good step that can be done later, but is an invitation to a rabbit hole that I am avoiding.

values.description:
Pulled @{557058:24cd6b3d-30bb-4c42-9e4b-f5836c392874} 's changes from pull request #3038 and:

* merged with `gazebo10`
* did some modernizing (remove boost, use `make_shared`...)
* publishing the updated world pose, otherwise the sensor visual was not moving when the sensor moved
* added a spherical sonar to the demo world
* :warning: **Big change**: The `range` was being treated as the sphere's diameter. But it makes more sense to me to treat it as the radius. @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} , you approved the other PR. What do you think of this?

![sonar.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3149194544-sonar.gif)
values.title: Spherical sonar, take 2

summary.raw:
Pulled @{557058:24cd6b3d-30bb-4c42-9e4b-f5836c392874} 's changes from pull request #3038 and:

* merged with `gazebo10`
* did some modernizing (remove boost, use `make_shared`...)
* publishing the updated world pose, otherwise the sensor visual was not moving when the sensor moved
* added a spherical sonar to the demo world
* :warning: **Big change**: The `range` was being treated as the sphere's diameter. But it makes more sense to me to treat it as the radius. @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} , you approved the other PR. What do you think of this?

![sonar.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/3149194544-sonar.gif)
summary.html:
Pulled @Olivier Crave 's changes from pull request #3038 and:

  • merged with gazebo10
  • did some modernizing (remove boost, use make_shared...)
  • publishing the updated world pose, otherwise the sensor visual was not moving when the sensor moved
  • added a spherical sonar to the demo world
  • Big change: The range was being treated as the sphere's diameter. But it makes more sense to me to treat it as the radius. @Ian Chen , you approved the other PR. What do you think of this?

values.description:
This backports two fixes to `SystemPaths` from the `citadel_deps_msgs` branch:

* d137f54 is grafted directly and fixes a race condition during initialization of the `static PathDelimiter` variable by replacing it with a `pathDelimiter()` function.

* c5b0aa1 is not fully used because `ignition-common` isn't a required dependency in gazebo9, but a missing call to `sdf::addURIPath` is added as a one-line fix.

See the following thread for more context:

* #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3139/update-to-ignition-citadel-dependencies-c/diff#comment-130449637
values.title: SystemPaths: replace static PathDelimiter variable with pathDelimiter() function to avoid undefined static initialization behavior

summary.raw:
This backports two fixes to `SystemPaths` from the `citadel_deps_msgs` branch:

* d137f54 is grafted directly and fixes a race condition during initialization of the `static PathDelimiter` variable by replacing it with a `pathDelimiter()` function.

* c5b0aa1 is not fully used because `ignition-common` isn't a required dependency in gazebo9, but a missing call to `sdf::addURIPath` is added as a one-line fix.

See the following thread for more context:

* #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3139/update-to-ignition-citadel-dependencies-c/diff#comment-130449637
summary.html:
This backports two fixes to SystemPaths from the citadel_deps_msgs branch:

  • d137f54 is grafted directly and fixes a race condition during initialization of the static PathDelimiter variable by replacing it with a pathDelimiter() function.

  • c5b0aa1 is not fully used because ignition-common isn't a required dependency in gazebo9, but a missing call to sdf::addURIPath is added as a one-line fix.

See the following thread for more context:

  • #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3139/update-to-ignition-citadel-dependencies-c/diff#comment-130449637

values.description: I've noticed numerous improvements to the `ColladaLoader` that have been submitted both here and to `ign-common`. I believe the `gazebo::common::MeshManager` could be changed to use `ignition::common::ColladaLoader`, so I'm PIMPL-izing the `MeshManager` to simplify that process. I've also made the `ign-common3-graphics` component required, and included the `ign-common3-profiler` component as well. Since `gts` is a required dependency of `ign-common3-graphics`, we could also make it a required dependency of gazebo11, but the cmake find logic for gts on windows is [a bit complex](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/126d3fd87e884fc6b87e4b35e4bc1453f414ef12/cmake/FindGTS.cmake#lines-23:79), so I've left it as is for now.
values.title: PIMPL-ize MeshManager, require ign-common3 graphics and profiler components

summary.raw: I've noticed numerous improvements to the `ColladaLoader` that have been submitted both here and to `ign-common`. I believe the `gazebo::common::MeshManager` could be changed to use `ignition::common::ColladaLoader`, so I'm PIMPL-izing the `MeshManager` to simplify that process. I've also made the `ign-common3-graphics` component required, and included the `ign-common3-profiler` component as well. Since `gts` is a required dependency of `ign-common3-graphics`, we could also make it a required dependency of gazebo11, but the cmake find logic for gts on windows is [a bit complex](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/src/126d3fd87e884fc6b87e4b35e4bc1453f414ef12/cmake/FindGTS.cmake#lines-23:79), so I've left it as is for now.
summary.html: I've noticed numerous improvements to the ColladaLoader that have been submitted both here and to ign-common. I believe the gazebo::common::MeshManager could be changed to use ignition::common::ColladaLoader, so I'm PIMPL-izing the MeshManager to simplify that process. I've also made the ign-common3-graphics component required, and included the ign-common3-profiler component as well. Since gts is a required dependency of ign-common3-graphics, we could also make it a required dependency of gazebo11, but the cmake find logic for gts on windows is a bit complex, so I've left it as is for now.

values.description:
These are the changes needed for successful building and running Gazebo 9 with OGRE 1.10 on Windows 10.

This is [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2787/win\_addpathbat-updated-to-work-with-gazebo](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2787/win_addpathbat-updated-to-work-with-gazebo#comment-130064597) retargetted to gazebo9.
values.title: Fix gazebo9 build and run on Windows.

summary.raw:
These are the changes needed for successful building and running Gazebo 9 with OGRE 1.10 on Windows 10.

values.description: This was split out from pull request #2502 (synchronize physics and sensor updates). This adds an API for directly updating object poses in a Scene instead of using the `~/pose/local/info` transport topic, which should reduce latency and improve determinism. To avoid a dependency relationship between physics and sensors, the `rendering::update_scene_poses(...)` function is passed by `gazebo::Server` as a `std::function` to physics when initializing a world. I made the `std::function` an optional parameter that defaults to `nullptr` to preserve API. Alternatively we could overload the function and deprecate the one that doesn't take a `std::function`?
values.title: Use direct API call to Scene::SetPoseMsg to update poses from physics for server-side rendering

summary.raw: This was split out from pull request #2502 (synchronize physics and sensor updates). This adds an API for directly updating object poses in a Scene instead of using the `~/pose/local/info` transport topic, which should reduce latency and improve determinism. To avoid a dependency relationship between physics and sensors, the `rendering::update_scene_poses(...)` function is passed by `gazebo::Server` as a `std::function` to physics when initializing a world. I made the `std::function` an optional parameter that defaults to `nullptr` to preserve API. Alternatively we could overload the function and deprecate the one that doesn't take a `std::function`?
summary.html: This was split out from pull request #2502 (synchronize physics and sensor updates). This adds an API for directly updating object poses in a Scene instead of using the ~/pose/local/info transport topic, which should reduce latency and improve determinism. To avoid a dependency relationship between physics and sensors, the rendering::update_scene_poses(...) function is passed by gazebo::Server as a std::function to physics when initializing a world. I made the std::function an optional parameter that defaults to nullptr to preserve API. Alternatively we could overload the function and deprecate the one that doesn't take a std::function?

values.description:
This supercedes [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2673](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2673)

Since we extended the noise description in SDF to support dynamic bias stddev and correlation time to support ign-sensors and ign-gazebo, I reused those values and implementation here.  Both the ign-sensors variant and here use @{557058:169ff364-18d4-4ba3-bf5a-4fd0ab88c331} 's original design of passing `dt` into the `Apply` method for noise.

‌

* SDFormat: [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/525](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/525)
* Ignition Sensors: [https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/58](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/58)

‌
values.title: Cross port dynamic bias noise parameters from ign-sensors

summary.raw:
This supercedes [#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2673](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2673)

Since we extended the noise description in SDF to support dynamic bias stddev and correlation time to support ign-sensors and ign-gazebo, I reused those values and implementation here.  Both the ign-sensors variant and here use @{557058:169ff364-18d4-4ba3-bf5a-4fd0ab88c331} 's original design of passing `dt` into the `Apply` method for noise.

‌

* SDFormat: [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/525](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/525)
* Ignition Sensors: [https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/58](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/58)

summary.html:
This supercedes #!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2673

Since we extended the noise description in SDF to support dynamic bias stddev and correlation time to support ign-sensors and ign-gazebo, I reused those values and implementation here. Both the ign-sensors variant and here use @James Goppert 's original design of passing dt into the Apply method for noise.

‌

  • SDFormat: https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/525
  • Ignition Sensors: https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-sensors/pull-requests/58

‌

values.description:
Alternative fix for pull request #3097 submitted by @{557058:619abb83-31a0-42fe-a248-af179f545e4d} 

Issue #1858

Description of the fix from this [comment](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3097/workaround-for-road-segments-in-world-file/diff#comment-131670184):

The road msgs are re-published when a scene info request is received \(this happens when the scene on the sensor side created\). This ensures that the road msgs are sent only when needed. I also updated the rendering side to make sure duplicate road visuals are not created.

To verify the fix, I added a camera sensor in `road.world`. To test, launch gazebo with `road.world`, go to topic viewer \(ctrl\+t\) and select `/gazebo/default/camera/link/camera/image` topic. Verify that the roads now appear in the camera images.
values.title: Fix missing road segments in camera sensors

summary.raw:
Alternative fix for pull request #3097 submitted by @{557058:619abb83-31a0-42fe-a248-af179f545e4d} 

Issue #1858

Description of the fix from this [comment](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3097/workaround-for-road-segments-in-world-file/diff#comment-131670184):

The road msgs are re-published when a scene info request is received \(this happens when the scene on the sensor side created\). This ensures that the road msgs are sent only when needed. I also updated the rendering side to make sure duplicate road visuals are not created.

To verify the fix, I added a camera sensor in `road.world`. To test, launch gazebo with `road.world`, go to topic viewer \(ctrl\+t\) and select `/gazebo/default/camera/link/camera/image` topic. Verify that the roads now appear in the camera images.
summary.html:
Alternative fix for pull request #3097 submitted by @Micho Radovnikovich

Issue #1858

Description of the fix from this comment:

The road msgs are re-published when a scene info request is received (this happens when the scene on the sensor side created). This ensures that the road msgs are sent only when needed. I also updated the rendering side to make sure duplicate road visuals are not created.

To verify the fix, I added a camera sensor in road.world. To test, launch gazebo with road.world, go to topic viewer (ctrl+t) and select /gazebo/default/camera/link/camera/image topic. Verify that the roads now appear in the camera images.

values.description:
Builds on top of @{557058:ad32c2b0-bebb-403e-b385-c3c1f7aa1d09} 's pull request and:

* Merges from `default` (Gazebo 11)
* Port some small tweaks from the equivalent changes on Ignition (`ign-common`, `ign-rendering`, `ign-gazebo`)
* Fix COLLADA offset so `worlds/actor.world` still works as before.
* Move new protected variables to `ActorPrivate` so this can be easily backported if needed.
values.title: BVH actor - on top of pull request #2957

summary.raw:
Builds on top of @{557058:ad32c2b0-bebb-403e-b385-c3c1f7aa1d09} 's pull request and:

* Merges from `default` (Gazebo 11)
* Port some small tweaks from the equivalent changes on Ignition (`ign-common`, `ign-rendering`, `ign-gazebo`)
* Fix COLLADA offset so `worlds/actor.world` still works as before.
* Move new protected variables to `ActorPrivate` so this can be easily backported if needed.
summary.html:
Builds on top of @mingfei sun 's pull request and:

  • Merges from default (Gazebo 11)
  • Port some small tweaks from the equivalent changes on Ignition (ign-common, ign-rendering, ign-gazebo)
  • Fix COLLADA offset so worlds/actor.world still works as before.
  • Move new protected variables to ActorPrivate so this can be easily backported if needed.

values.description:
There was an issue recording and then playing back log files that contained SDF 1.6 which didn't conform to SDF 1,7 expectations. For example, [this tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=log_filtering&cat=tools_utilities) would successfully record the log file, but Gazebo would crash on playback.

This PR, together with [this SDF PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/655/) makes that tutorial playback the log file correctly, with the only consequence being a few errors printed:

~~~
[Err] [World.cc:190] Error Code 8 Msg: A <script> element is missing a child <uri> element, or the <uri> element is empty.
[Err] [World.cc:190] Error Code 8 Msg: A <script> element is missing a child <uri> element, or the <uri> element is empty.
[Err] [World.cc:190] Error Code 8 Msg: A <script> element is missing a child <uri> element, or the <uri> element is empty.
[Err] [World.cc:190] Error Code 8 Msg: A <script> element is missing a child <uri> element, or the <uri> element is empty.
~~~
values.title: Load SDF 1.7 even if there are errors

There was an issue recording and then playing back log files that contained SDF 1.6 which didn't conform to SDF 1,7 expectations. This PR, together with [this SDF PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-requests/655/) makes that tutorial playback the log file correctly, with the only consequence being a few errors printed:

~~~

[Err] [World.cc:190] Error Code 8 Msg: A <script> element is missing a child <uri> element, or the <uri> element is empty.

summary.html:
There was an issue recording and then playing back log files that contained SDF 1.6 which didn't conform to SDF 1,7 expectations. For example, this tutorial would successfully record the log file, but Gazebo would crash on playback.

This PR, together with this SDF PR makes that tutorial playback the log file correctly, with the only consequence being a few errors printed:

[Err] [World.cc:190] Error Code 8 Msg: A <script> element is missing a child <uri> element, or the <uri> element is empty.
[Err] [World.cc:190] Error Code 8 Msg: A <script> element is missing a child <uri> element, or the <uri> element is empty.
[Err] [World.cc:190] Error Code 8 Msg: A <script> element is missing a child <uri> element, or the <uri> element is empty.

values.description:
Refletance must be an image.

To include the reflectance:

```
<link>
...
  <visual name="visual">
    ...
      <plugin filename="libReflectancePlugin.so" name="reflectance_plugin">
        <reflectance_map>
          <uri>model://suv/materials/textures/</uri>
          <name>wheels_01.png</name>
        </reflectance_map>
      </plugin>
      ...
   </visual>
...
</link>
```

```
<link>
...
  <visual name="visual">
    ...
      <plugin filename="libReflectancePlugin.so" name="reflectance_plugin">
        <reflectance_map>
          <name>${YOUR_HOME_HERE}/.gazebo/models/suv/materials/textures/wheels_01.png</name>
        </reflectance_map>
      </plugin>
      ...
   </visual>
...
</link>
```

‌

```
<link>
...
  <visual name="visual">
    ...
      <plugin filename="libReflectancePlugin.so" name="reflectance_plugin">
        <reflectance_map>
            <uri>${YOUR_HOME_HERE}/.gazebo/models/suv/materials/textures/</uri>
            <name>wheels_01.png</name>
        </reflectance_map>
      </plugin>
      ...
   </visual>
...
</link>
```

‌

values.description:
This is an attempt at fixing issue #2692.

That issue seems to occur on Gazebo 7, but not on Gazebo 9.

@{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} pointed out that we're making X11 calls on `gazebo7`, but not on `gazebo9`, see [here](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/f0d3578207d5149e3709947558b5846ce79d02b3/gazebo/gui/GLWidget.cc#lines-927).

I changed `gazebo7` to use the same pattern as `gazebo9` and it worked fine for me locally on Linux. I decided not to touch Windows because I wouldn't have how to test it.
values.title: Remove X11 call from Gazebo 7

summary.raw:
This is an attempt at fixing issue #2692.

That issue seems to occur on Gazebo 7, but not on Gazebo 9.

@{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5} pointed out that we're making X11 calls on `gazebo7`, but not on `gazebo9`, see [here](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/f0d3578207d5149e3709947558b5846ce79d02b3/gazebo/gui/GLWidget.cc#lines-927).

I changed `gazebo7` to use the same pattern as `gazebo9` and it worked fine for me locally on Linux. I decided not to touch Windows because I wouldn't have how to test it.
summary.html:
This is an attempt at fixing issue #2692.

That issue seems to occur on Gazebo 7, but not on Gazebo 9.

@Ian Chen pointed out that we're making X11 calls on gazebo7, but not on gazebo9, see here.

I changed gazebo7 to use the same pattern as gazebo9 and it worked fine for me locally on Linux. I decided not to touch Windows because I wouldn't have how to test it.

values.description:
Problem: The Visual’s bounding box’s min and max values are initialized to zeros. But for a visual with a link at an offset \(.e.g. a positive offset\), the bounding box computation incorrectly merges the empty bounding box located at zero position with the link’s bounding box resulting in the final bounding box that is larger than it should be.

This PR changes the initialization to `+/- MAX_D`, which is consistent with they way it’s done in [physics::Link](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/f0d3578207d5149e3709947558b5846ce79d02b3/gazebo/physics/Link.cc#lines-829).

To avoid breaking the fix for CoM visualization submitted in pull request #2934, a zero sized bounding box is returned for empty visuals.
values.title: Fix bounding box calculation for visuals that have links with pose offset

summary.raw:
Problem: The Visual’s bounding box’s min and max values are initialized to zeros. But for a visual with a link at an offset \(.e.g. a positive offset\), the bounding box computation incorrectly merges the empty bounding box located at zero position with the link’s bounding box resulting in the final bounding box that is larger than it should be.

This PR changes the initialization to `+/- MAX_D`, which is consistent with they way it’s done in [physics::Link](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/f0d3578207d5149e3709947558b5846ce79d02b3/gazebo/physics/Link.cc#lines-829).

To avoid breaking the fix for CoM visualization submitted in pull request #2934, a zero sized bounding box is returned for empty visuals.
summary.html:
Problem: The Visual’s bounding box’s min and max values are initialized to zeros. But for a visual with a link at an offset (.e.g. a positive offset), the bounding box computation incorrectly merges the empty bounding box located at zero position with the link’s bounding box resulting in the final bounding box that is larger than it should be.

This PR changes the initialization to +/- MAX_D, which is consistent with they way it’s done in physics::Link.

To avoid breaking the fix for CoM visualization submitted in pull request #2934, a zero sized bounding box is returned for empty visuals.

values.description:
The depth camera sensor currently assumes that depth data is always available, which is not  the case, .e.g when the requests for point cloud data instead of depth data.

I ran into this problem when reviewing pull request #3194. I tried to visualize depth data but forgot that it’s actually not generating any depth images.

To test, apply this patch to depth\_camera.world to let the depth sensor to generate point clouds:

```
diff -r f0d3578207d5 worlds/depth_camera.world
--- a/worlds/depth_camera.world	Fri Jan 31 13:51:10 2020 -0800
+++ b/worlds/depth_camera.world	Mon Feb 24 16:10:14 2020 -0800
@@ -73,6 +73,9 @@
               <near>0.1</near>
               <far>20</far>
             </clip>
+            <depth_camera>
+              <output>points</output>
+            </depth_camera>
           </camera>
           <plugin filename="libDepthCameraPlugin.so" name="depth_camera_plugin" />
           <always_on>true</always_on>
```

Launch gazebo with this world, go to the Topic Visualization window \(ctrl \+ t\), select the depth camera image topic and gazebo should crash without the changes in this PR.
values.title: Prevent crash when subscribing to depth camera image topic

summary.raw:

```
@@ -73,6 +73,9 @@

+            </depth_camera>

           <always_on>true</always_on>
```

Launch gazebo with this world, go to the Topic Visualization window \(ctrl \+ t\), select the depth camera image topic and gazebo should crash without the changes in this PR.
summary.html:
The depth camera sensor currently assumes that depth data is always available, which is not the case, .e.g when the requests for point cloud data instead of depth data.

I ran into this problem when reviewing pull request #3194. I tried to visualize depth data but forgot that it’s actually not generating any depth images.

To test, apply this patch to depth_camera.world to let the depth sensor to generate point clouds:

diff -r f0d3578207d5 worlds/depth_camera.world
--- a/worlds/depth_camera.world Fri Jan 31 13:51:10 2020 -0800
+++ b/worlds/depth_camera.world Mon Feb 24 16:10:14 2020 -0800
@@ -73,6 +73,9 @@
               <near>0.1</near>
               <far>20</far>
             </clip>
+            <depth_camera>
+              <output>points</output>
+            </depth_camera>
           </camera>
           <plugin filename="libDepthCameraPlugin.so" name="depth_camera_plugin" />
           <always_on>true</always_on>

Launch gazebo with this world, go to the Topic Visualization window (ctrl + t), select the depth camera image topic and gazebo should crash without the changes in this PR.

values.description:
Disable warnings 4251 and 4275 in Visual Studio

The warnings 4251 (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/error-messages/compiler-warnings/compiler-warning-level-1-c4251) 
and 4275 (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/cpp/error-messages/compiler-warnings/compiler-warning-level-2-c4275) are useful 
Visual Studio warnings in some situations, but they can be safely ignored in most situations.
values.title: Disable warnings 4251 and 4275 in Visual Studio
